contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Wise''', of King’s Lynn in the County of Norfolk, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1951 for the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] politician [[Frederick Wise, 1st Baron Wise|Frederick Wise]]. He had previously represented [[King's Lynn (UK Parliament constituency)|King's Lynn]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]]. {{As of|2012}} the title is held by his grandson, the third Baron, who succeeded in 2012. ==Barons Wise (1951)== *[[Frederick Wise, 1st Baron Wise|Frederick John Wise, 1st Baron Wise]] (1887–1968) *John Clayton Wise, 2nd Baron Wise (1923-2012)[https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/peerage-news/44w5s7obo4E] *Christopher John Clayton Wise, 3rd Baron Wise (b. 1949) ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wise}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
